class.name: PIXI.EventTarget

public.name: emit
public.help: Emit an event to all registered event listeners.

public.name: listeners
public.help: Return a list of assigned event listeners.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.help: The events that should be listed.

public.name: mixin
public.help: Mixes in the properties of the EventTarget prototype onto another object

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.help: The event we want to remove.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The listener that we need to find.

public.name: on
public.help: Register a new EventListener for the given event.

public.name: once
public.help: Add an EventListener that's only called once.

public.name: removeAllListeners
public.help: Remove all listeners or only the listeners for the specified event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.help: The event you want to remove all listeners for.

public.name: stopImmediatePropagation
public.help: Stops the propagation of events to sibling listeners (no longer calls any listeners).

public.name: stopPropagation
public.help: Stops the propagation of events up the scene graph (prevents bubbling).

public.name: data
public.help: The data that was passed in with this event.

public.name: target
public.help: The original target the event triggered on.

public.name: timeStamp
public.help: The timestamp when the event occurred.

public.name: type
public.help: The string name of the event that this represents.

private.name: stopped
private.help: Tracks the state of bubbling propagation. Do not\nset this directly, instead use `event.stopPropagation()`

private.name: stoppedImmediate
private.help: Tracks the state of sibling listener propagation. Do not\nset this directly, instead use `event.stopImmediatePropagation()`
